name: Flow regulator
definition: process regulator that acts against a spring to maintain a constant flow value

name: Temperature regulator
definition: process regulator intended to modulate a fluid flow rate to maintain a predefined downstream process temperature

name: Differential pressure regulator
definition: process regulator that acts against a spring pressure to maintain a constant differential pressure

name: Process regulator
definition: final control element that comprises a self-actuating control valve intended to modulate a fluid flow rate to maintain a predefined upstream or downstream process pressure

name: Device LOP for coriolis mass flow transmitter
definition: list of properties characterizing a coriolis mass flow transmitter

name: Diffuser
definition: flow modification accessory that comprises a perforated plate, tube insert or similar construction of a fixed area that is mounted downstream of the valve body assembly

name: Restriction orifice
definition: flow modification accessory that comprises a plate with one or more holes

name: Flow modification accessory
definition: accessory of a control valve/automated on/off valve that is used to modify the characteristics of fluid flow

name: Volume tank
definition: actuator/valve accessory comprising a gas tank that provides a back-up in the event of loss of instrument fluid supply

name: Quick exhaust
definition: actuator/valve accessory that is a fast-acting valve used in a single-acting pneumatic actuator to quickly release pressure

name: Reversing amplifier
definition: actuator/valve accessory that operates a double-acting pneumatic actuator using a single-acting pneumatic or electro-pneumatic positioner or position switch

name: Back pressure/excess pressure regulator
definition: process regulator that acts against a spring pressure to maintain a constant upstream pressure

name: Pressure reducing regulator
definition: process regulator that acts against a spring pressure to maintain a constant downstream pressure

name: Air operated valve
definition: actuator/valve accessory comprising a valve with a 2/2, 3/2 or 5/2 relay triggered by a pneumatic signal

name: Filter regulator
definition: actuator/valve accessory comprising a regulator that is used to control the supply pressure to the valve actuator and its auxiliaries

name: Lock-up relay
definition: actuator/valve accessory that is a relay that locks in its energized position

name: Actuator relief valve
definition: actuator/valve accessory that is a safety valve which automatically relieves a pressure system when the pressure exceeds a set limit and which closes when pressure falls below the set limit

name: Volume booster
definition: actuator/valve accessory used together with a positioner to increase the positioning speed of a pneumatic actuator

name: Valve/actuator accessory
definition: that part of a control valve/automated on/off valve, usually attached to the actuator, which provides additional control functions

name: Manual rotary actuator
definition: rotary actuator that uses a handwheel or similar mechanical means to control its motion

name: Solenoid valve
definition: actuator/valve accessory comprising a valve with linear action which is fitted with a solenoid for quick operation

name: Pneumatic rotary actuator
definition: rotary actuator that uses a pneumatic signal to control its motion

name: Hydraulic rotary actuator
definition: rotary actuator that uses a hydraulic signal to control its motion

name: Electro-hydraulic rotary actuator
definition: rotary actuator that uses an electro-hydraulic signal to control its motion

name: Rotary actuator
definition: actuator that is rotated into or away from a seat to modulate flow

name: Electrical rotary actuator
definition: rotary actuator that uses an electrical signal to control its motion

name: Manual linear actuator
definition: linear actuator that uses a handwheel or similar mechanical means to control its motion

name: Electro-hydraulic linear actuator
definition: linear actuator that uses an electro-hydraulic signal to control its motion

name: Position transmitter
definition: actuator/valve accessory that is mechanically connected to the valve stem or shaft and generates and transmits a pneumatic or electrical signal representing the valve position

name: I/P converter
definition: actuator/valve accessory that is actuated by a current signal from one system and transmits power as a pneumatic signal to a second system

name: Electrical linear actuator
definition: linear actuator that uses an electrical signal to control its motion

name: Actuator
definition: that part of a control valve/automated on/off valve which transforms a signal into a corresponding movement controlling the position of the internal regulating mechanism (closure member)

name: Hydraulic linear actuator
definition: linear actuator that uses an hydraulic signal to control its motion

name: Linear actuator
definition: actuator that moves in a line perpendicular or parallel to the seating plane

name: Pneumatic linear actuator
definition: linear actuator that uses a pneumatic signal to control its motion

name: Limit switch
definition: actuator/valve accessory comprising a pneumatic, hydraulic or electrical device that relates to the valve stem to detect a single, preset valve stem position

name: Positioner
definition: actuator/valve accessory that is mechanically connected to a moving part of a final control element or its actuator and automatically adjusts its output to the actuator in order to maintain a desired position of the closure member in proportion to the input signal

name: Segmented ball valve
definition: valve with rotary motion with a closure member that is a segment of a sphere

name: Valve with rotary motion
definition: valve with a closure member that is rotated into or away from a seat to modulate flow

name: Valve body assembly (generic)
definition: valve body assembly with undefined with undefined motion

name: Ball valve
definition: valve with rotary motion with a closure member that is a sphere with an internal passage

name: Plug valve
definition: valve with rotary motion with a closure member that is cylindrical or conical, with an internal passage

name: Butterfly valve
definition: valve with rotary motion with a circular body and a rotary motion disk closure member, pivotally supported by its shaft

name: Eccentric plug valve
definition: valve with rotary motion with an eccentric closure member that may be in the shape of a spherical or conical segment

name: Control valve or automated on/off-valve
definition: final control element that changes a fluid flow rate either proportional to the magnitude (control valve) or cuts off/allows flow according to the state (automated cut-off valve) of a signal from a control or safety instrumented system

name: Final control element
definition: artifact that responds quantitatively to a control signal and performs the actual control action

name: Diaphragm/pinch valve
definition: valve with linear motion in which the fluid flow passage through the valve is changed by deformation of a flexible closure member

name: Valve with linear motion
definition: valve with a closure member that is moved linearly into or away from a seat to modulate the flow

name: Weir
definition: primary element that generates a difference in head by partially obstructing the flow in an open channel

name: Sonic nozzle (critical flow nozzle, critical flow venture)
definition: primary element that generates a pressure by restricting the flow of gas in a pipe such that it attains sonic velocity

name: Valve body assembly
definition: that part of a control valve/automated on/off cut-off valve that forms a pressure retaining envelope which contains a closure member for changing the flow rate

name: Gate valve
definition: valve with linear motion whose closure member is a flat gate that moves in a direction parallel to the plane of the seat

name: Pitot tube
definition: primary element that measures the stagnation pressure of the flow at a point in a pipe

name: Orifice plate
definition: primary element that generates a difference in pressure by partially obstructing the flow in pipe

name: Nozzle
definition: primary element that generates a difference in pressure by restricting the flow in pipe

name: Flume
definition: primary element that generates a difference in head by restricting the flow in an open channel

name: Integral transmitter
definition: transmitter mounted as an integral part of an assembly containing the sensing element

name: Manifold
definition: instrument component comprising any configuration of valves which can be manipulated to create zero differential pressure at the measuring instrument

name: Primary element
definition: instrument component that quantitatively converts the measured variable energy into a form suitable for measurement

name: Insert/element
definition: instrument component that permits a non-wetted and exchangeable sensing element to be placed as close as possible to the point of measurement and provides a connection to an external evaluation system

name: Globe valve
definition: valve with linear motion in which the closure member moves in a direction perpendicular to the plane of the seat(s)

name: Rack-mounted density transmitter
definition: separate density transmitter designed for mounting in a rack

name: Panel-mounted density transmitter
definition: separate density transmitter designed for mounting in a control panel

name: Field-mounted density transmitter
definition: separate density transmitter designed for mounting in the field

name: Separate density transmitter
definition: separate transmitter designed for density measurement

name: Panel-mounted level transmitter/switching unit
definition: separate level transmitter or switching unit designed for mounting in a control panel

name: Rack-mounted level transmitter/switching unit
definition: separate level transmitter or switching unit designed for mounting in a rack

name: Head-mounted density transmitter
definition: separate density transmitter designed for mounting in a connection head

name: Field-mounted level transmitter/switching unit
definition: separate level transmitter or switching unit designed for mounting in the field

name: Separate level transmitter/switching unit
definition: separate transmitter or switching unit designed for level measurement

name: Head-mounted level transmitter/switching unit
definition: separate level transmitter or switching unit designed for mounting in a connection head

name: Rack-mounted temperature transmitter
definition: separate temperature transmitter designed for mounting in a rack

name: Separate temperature transmitter
definition: separate transmitter designed for temperature measurement

name: Rack-mounted flow transmitter
definition: separate flow transmitter designed for mounting in a rack

name: Field-mounted temperature transmitter
definition: separate temperature transmitter designed for mounting in the field

name: Separate transmitter
definition: transmitter mounted at a location removed (locally or remotely) from an assembly containing the sensing element but connected to it by signal line

name: Transmitter
definition: instrument component that is accepts a process variable and to converts it according to a definite law into a standardized output signal

name: Panel-mounted temperature transmitter
definition: separate temperature transmitter designed for mounting in a control panel

name: Thermal detector
definition: infrared radiation detector that uses a heat sensitive sensing element to sense temperature

name: Infrared radiation detector
definition: temperature element that uses the dependence of radiation on temperature to sense temperature

name: Photon detector
definition: infrared radiation detector that uses a photosensitive sensing element to sense temperature

name: Head-mounted temperature transmitter
definition: separate temperature transmitter designed for mounting in a connection head

name: Thermocouple (TC)
definition: temperature element comprising a pair of electrical conductors of dissimilar materials joined together at the hot end

name: Voltage temperature element
definition: temperature element that uses the dependence of voltage on temperature to sense temperature

name: RTD element
definition: resistance temperature element that uses an RTD to sense temperature

name: Thermistor element
definition: resistance temperature element that uses a thermistor to sense temperature

name: Panel-mounted flow transmitter
definition: separate flow transmitter designed for mounting in a control panel

name: Resistance temperature element
definition: temperature element that uses the dependence of electrical resistance on temperature to sense temperature

name: Proximity probe
definition: sensing element that senses proximity

name: Strain gauge element
definition: force sensing element that converts an elastic deformation into an analog electrical signal

name: Temperature element
definition: sensing element that senses temperature

name: Force sensing element
definition: sensing element that senses force and converts it to an electrical signal

name: Load cell
definition: force sensing element that converts a load acting on it into an analog electrical signal

name: Sensing element
definition: instrument component that is the primary element of a measuring chain and which may convert the input variable into a signal suitable for use by other instruments in that chain

name: Booster relay
definition: amplifier that is intended to increase the power of a pneumatic signal

name: Separate flow transmitter
definition: separate transmitter designed for flow measurement

name: Field-mounted flow transmitter
definition: separate flow transmitter designed for mounting in the field

name: Head-mounted flow transmitter
definition: separate flow transmitter designed for mounting in a connection head

name: Electrical relay
definition: relay that is intended to be operated electrically and to make or break another electrical circuit

name: Pneumatic relay
definition: relay that is intended to be pneumatically operated and to make or break another pneumatic circuit

name: Relay
definition: device or instrument component that is operated by a change in state and makes or breaks a flow in another circuit

name: Window
definition: fitting that provides a view of the object or medium to be measured

name: Stilling well
definition: fitting comprising a vertical tube in a tank or vessel that creates an environment where a liquid level is measured

name: Thermowell extension
definition: fitting that is a tube or nipple union system for extending the distance between a thermowell and a connection head

name: Protection tube
definition: fitting that is a tube for protection of a sensing element

name: Extended diaphragm seal
definition: remote seal that is mounted at the end of a tube extension

name: Inline seal
definition: remote seal that is built into a pipe section

name: Extension tube
definition: fitting that is a tube for extending the distance between a sensing element and a transmitter

name: Thermowell
definition: fitting that is a pressure-tight tube, which protects a temperature sensing element against the environment or process material as well as mechanical force

name: Bypass/measuring chamber
definition: fitting comprising a chamber that creates an environment where a liquid level is measured

name: Fitting
definition: instrument component that permits a change in direction, a change in size, a branch, a connection or a fixation

name: Pressure to current converter
definition: converter that converts pneumatic or hydraulic energy into electrical energy

name: Analog to digital converter
definition: converter that converts an analog signal into a digital signal

name: Capsule/probe seal
definition: remote seal that comprises a tongue or tube

name: Remote seal
definition: instrument component for a pressure gauge, transmitter or switch that seals and isolates the measuring instrument but when immersed in the process medium allows pressure effects to cross to the measuring instrument sensing element

name: Flush diaphragm seal
definition: remote seal that is flush mounted in a process connection

name: Frequency to analog converter
definition: converter that converts a frequency to an analog current

name: Digital to analog converter
definition: converter that converts a digital, usually binary, code to an analog current

name: Current to hydraulic converter
definition: converter that converts electrical energy into hydraulic energy

name: Current to pneumatic converter
definition: converter that converts electrical energy into pneumatic energy

name: Converter
definition: instrument component that converts energy from one form to another

name: Solid mass flow transmitter
definition: weight transmitter that is intended to give the mass flow of bulk material

name: Connection head
definition: instrument component comprising an enclosure containing a connection element which is mechanically connected to the sensing element and which enables the installation of another instrument component such as a head-mounted transmitter or terminal block

name: Measuring instrument component
definition: entity within a measuring instrument that plays a specific role and which can be handled separately if necessary

name: Temperature transmitter connection head
definition: instrument component comprising an enclosure with facilities for the electrical connection of sensing element and output cable that also provides protection against dust, moisture and corrosion

name: Strain gauge weight transmitter
definition: weight transmitter that uses the strain in an elastic material to measure a weight

name: Analog signal switch
definition: instrument component that provides connection or disconnection between analog input(s) and output(s) depending on activation

name: Voltage transmitter
definition: transmitter that outputs a signal representative of an electrical potential

name: Weight transmitter
definition: transmitter that outputs a signal representative of an weight

name: Anemometer
definition: velocity transmitter that measures gas velocity, typically wind speed

name: Velocity transmitter
definition: transmitter that outputs a signal representative of a velocity

name: Area temperature measuring device (thermographic device)
definition: radiation temperature transmitter that measures or images the spatial distribution of surface temperature or thermal radiation across an area

name: Line scanner
definition: line temperature measuring device with a single detector that samples radiation sequentially along a line by opto-mechanical means

name: Line temperature measuring device
definition: radiation temperature transmitter that measures the temperature or temperature profile along a line

name: Thermographic device with matrix detector
definition: area temperature measuring device with a two-dimensional array of individual detectors that samples radiation simultaneously across an area by electronic means

name: Thermographic device with line detector
definition: area temperature measuring device with a multi-element line detector that samples radiation sequentially across an area by scanning with opto-mechanical means

name: Thermographic device with single element detector
definition: area temperature measuring device with a single detector that samples radiation sequentially across an area by opto-mechanical means

name: Line camera
definition: line temperature measuring device with a multi-element line detector that samples radiation simultaneously along a line by electronic means

name: Temperature transmitter (generic)
definition: Temperature transmitter with undefined measuring principle

name: Transfer radiation thermometer
definition: radiation thermometer of high precision that are used to relay a temperature scale, with a small measurement uncertainty, from a national metrology institute to accredited and industrial calibration laboratories and to research laboratories

name: Intensity comparison thermometer
definition: radiance thermometer that compares the radiation produced by a hot object with the radiation produced by a hot filament, the temperature measured corresponding to the temperature of the hot filament when the intensities are equal

name: Ratio radiation thermometer
definition: radiation thermometer that measures temperature by determining the ratio of the radiance in two different spectral ranges

name: Ratio radiation thermometer with double detectors
definition: ratio radiation thermometer with a double (sandwich detector) that has two sensitive layers with different spectral sensitivities

name: Multichannel radiation thermometer
definition: radiation thermometer that measures temperature by determining the ratio of the radiance more than two difference spectral ranges

name: Ratio radiation thermometer with two independent detectors
definition: ratio radiation thermometer with two detectors, in which the radiation is divided with a beam splitter and two filters into two distinct spectral ranges

name: Multichannel radiation thermometer with multiple independent detectors
definition: multichannel radiation thermometer with more than two detectors, in which the radiation is divided with a beam splitter and more than two filters into more than two distinct spectral ranges

name: Ratio radiation thermometer with filter wheel
definition: ratio radiation thermometer with a single detector in which the radiation is interrupted periodically by a modulator with two filters

name: Multichannel radiation thermometer with filter wheel
definition: multichannel radiation thermometer with a single detector in which the radiation is interrupted periodically by a modulator with more than two filters

name: Point temperature measuring device
definition: radiation temperature transmitter that measures the temperature at one point on the surface of an object

name: Radiation temperature transmitter
definition: non-contact temperature transmitter that calculates the temperature based on the infrared radiation emitted by an object over one or more given spectral ranges

name: Non-contact temperature transmitter
definition: temperature transmitter, the sensing element of which has no physical contact to the media or object being measured

name: Temperature transmitter
definition: transmitter that outputs a signal representative of a temperature

name: Band radiation thermometer
definition: radiance thermometer that is sensitive to a broad spectral range

name: Total radiation thermometer
definition: radiance thermometer that is sensitive to virtually the entire energy-effective spectral range

name: Spectral radiation thermometer
definition: radiance thermometer that is sensitive only in a narrow spectral range

name: Power transmitter
definition: transmitter that outputs a signal representative of an electrical power

name: Pressure transmitter
definition: transmitter that outputs a signal representative of a pressure

name: Radiance thermometer
definition: radiation thermometer that measures temperature by using a narrow, a broad or a very broad spectral range

name: Radiation thermometer
definition: point temperature measuring device that uses one or more spectral ranges to measure a mean temperature

name: Gauge pressure transmitter
definition: pressure transmitter that measures the pressure applied to a sensing element relative to atmospheric pressure

name: Contact temperature transmitter
definition: temperature transmitter, the sensing element of which is in contact with the media or object being measured

name: Gravimetric level transmitter
definition: level transmitter that uses the weight of the material in a vessel to measure level

name: Differential pressure transmitter
definition: pressure transmitter that measures the difference in pressure applied to two sides of a sensing element

name: Absolute pressure transmitter
definition: pressure transmitter that measures the pressure applied to a sensing element relative to vacuum

name: Laser level transmitter
definition: wave level transmitter that uses the travelling time of a laser beam to measure level

name: Wave level transmitter
definition: level transmitter that measures the level by detecting either a propagation time or a damping of a propagation phenomenon of waves

name: Level transmitter (generic)
definition: level transmitter with undefined measuring principle

name: Guided-wave radar level transmitter
definition: radar level transmitter that emits a wave that is guided by a rod, cable or rope to the surface of process material and uses the time of flight of the reflected wave to measure level

name: Ultrasonic level transmitter
definition: wave level transmitter that uses the travelling time of an ultrasonic beam to measure level

name: Optical refraction level transmitter
definition: optical level transmitter that uses the difference between the refractive index of the process fluid and the material of the sensing element to measure level

name: Continuous-wave radar level transmitter
definition: free-space radar level transmitter that uses a continuous radar wave to measure level

name: Pulsed-wave radar level transmitter
definition: free-space radar level transmitter that uses a pulsed radar wave to measure level

name: Optical level transmitter
definition: level transmitter that uses the transmission, reflection or refraction of light by the process material to measure level

name: Free-space radar level transmitter
